general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce Lightning Continues to Impress and Surprise
lesson_learned.summary: We've been really pleased with the Salesforce Lightning Platform.  We've been able to increase adoption and CRM usage in our organization.  We value the flexibility of the platform and being able to configure or customize it to meet our needs.  Plus, new and exciting features are continually introduced and released.
lesson_learned.liked_most: All of the options and flexibility that are included with delivered features that can be configured
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Sometimes the performance/speed isn't *quite* what we'd like for it to be.
lesson_learned.advice: 1) Talk with other customers when making your purchase decisions. 2) The larger Salesforce online community is active on multiple platforms and is a great resource.  There are lots of opportunities to connect.
lesson_learned.do_differently: I think we would probably try and increase stakeholder involvement and focus more on adoption with the initial implementation.

general_info.review_source: Self directed (Gartner.com, search, ad/promo)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce Lightning Will Improve Efficiency
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce Lightning has improved the functionality of logging and tracking events for my team. We are able to store data on the cloud under a single platform, which enables us to access our information on-the-go and in the office. We no longer have to rely on multiple Excel sheets to track our data, and we're able to make edits as necessary. Further, Salesforce has allowed us to automate our confirmation procedure when scheduling events with different venues and vendors.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The ability to access information through the Salesforce cloud has enabled us to keep track of our information and events from anywhere, at any time. The program has greatly improved our efficiency and allows us to confirm events with one click, limiting the amount of paper and emails used.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The inability to seamlessly and continuously export data to Excel for reporting purposes is a major limitation in the Salesforce model. Basic users under the free version should still be able to export data easily. We have not been able to show quarterly or yearly results through the Salesforce platform, which has delayed our reporting to the state.
lesson_learned.advice: I would definitely advise budgeting for the premium version of the platform. Salesforce has all of the bells and whistles needed to work entirely through the cloud, but the free version does not offer the ability to easily export data.
lesson_learned.do_differently: We would likely pay to have at least one user on the advanced platform, which would allow us to export data for reports more functionally. Unfortunately, that money is not currently in the budget for the upcoming fiscal year. Otherwise, we have had success with Salesforce Lightning.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: Lightning is a Game-Changer
lesson_learned.summary: The Lightning Platform is a game-changer. Building applications is a truly fun experience. The speed at which these applications can be build is refreshing and the flexibility that is available makes this a wonderful way to build something for virtually any use case.
lesson_learned.liked_most: I love the flexibility the tool offers, as well as the user friendly UI - both for the end user, as well as the point-and-click capabilities that I as the system admin have available to build and configure everything. I appreciate the speed and ease with which applications can be build and customized - a very refreshing change to the slower speed of "traditional IT" experiences.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: When you first get started with Lightning, I greatly disliked the default page layouts. Updating them and making them relevant was one of the highest priorities. As an admin used to Classic, navigating the setup takes a bit of getting used to - but after a small period of discomfort I can honestly say: I don't miss the classic days a single bit!
lesson_learned.advice: Get involved in the community early. Check out Trailhead.com - a free tool to learn about Salesforce and its products. Also check out the AppExchange.

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: The customizability and reporting makes it worth it, but implementation is tough
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce is very customizable and good for managing large databases with lots of moving parts. There is a learning curve and it can take awhile to get it to do all the things you want. Do not undersestimate the implementaiton costs.
lesson_learned.liked_most: I love how easy it is to change the layout of a page and quickly add or remove fields.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: It can be tricky to figure out all the places fields are related.
lesson_learned.advice: Before moving to any new platform make sure your data is clean. Scrub away old data and download your data into a CSV file. If you can't understand it, then keep working on getting your data clean before import.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Totally reinvigorate your business with SLFP!
lesson_learned.summary: One can seamlessly embed your sales team into the salesforce lightning platform. Our marketing stint was improvised by integrating with SFLP which led to a gradual increase in business. feedback from various marketing heads is easy to incorporate. The features are easily visible on the dashboards and can be opened to see the details. Thus the dashboard looks like a great marketing flyer showcasing all the features of the program.
lesson_learned.liked_most: With SLFP, . Our staff is able to capture the lifecycle more prominently of the sales process. they can easily pull out/share/act on service reminders, documents. Meeting with school admins have become easier. Our footfall each semester has increased by good margins. We are able to share dashboards which have useful business insights which are auto updates and thus this eliminates re-sharing of reports
lesson_learned.disliked_most: the interface with lots of features becomes a little overwhelming. With little training and little acclimatization, things become easier. The support teams are at times not able to hit the problem directly and it does take time - so be patient in those situations.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: Lightning is where it’s at!! Move now!!
lesson_learned.summary: salesforce has pushed a lot of functionality that was lacking in classing in lightning. We really love this. there are key features that were not ported and thet are now getting a handle on. Lightning improves what we do so dramatically i cant begine to quantify without a study. We love it!!
lesson_learned.liked_most: we are now more in control of the iser experience and can tailor it more to our users than ever before. We have improved our agent and customer experienced by just a few simple features.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Its hard to migrate some of our features and it doesnt always translate gracefully in the design without a lot of effort.
lesson_learned.advice: as uou roll out new features include the services caralogue so we can continue our celocity with these new features thanks to your teams support.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Implementation was challenging, but the way lightning platform is going is nice
lesson_learned.summary:
You can really get things (and apps!) done without worrying about infrastructure.
Lightning Components is a very nice improvement over visualforce.

Giving four stars because:

1 SOQL is not that flexible, you end up writing database logic in apex classes or in worst case scenario messy big text fields containing structured content from child relations.

2 Salesforce ideaexchange has some ideas older than 8+ year and affecting standard salesforce object functionality - anyone can create workaround by cloning the logic into custom object but it is not very good idea

3 Lighting experience caching issues - there are no clear cache busting strategy for lightning components - end user has to refresh browser multiple times to get the latest version loaded
lesson_learned.liked_most:
- Modern look and feel
- Creating layouts are more flexible, you can add lightning components easily
- Navigation and other frontend apis
lesson_learned.disliked_most:
Browser caching causes sometimes ui not displaying latest information.
Random ui issues like certain ui refresh event causing infinite spinning animation on related lists
lesson_learned.advice:
If you need to write lightning components, prepare them well.
Also go for git version control + metadata deployments or use the newer salesforce dx

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Self directed (Gartner.com, search, ad/promo)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce Lightning Happy
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce account teams have been a class act for us. They have provided considerable value. Salesforce's free Trailhead training has been very useful. Lightning creates an environment where we can configure more and code less. Very useful.
lesson_learned.liked_most: We found that it was easier to do "greenfield" in Lightning, and not necessarily replicated the "classic" experience.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Wish it was available sooner!
lesson_learned.advice: Go "all in" with your Lightning approach if self service and rapid iteration are important.
lesson_learned.do_differently: Leverage more "out of the box" functionality and not try to customize as much.

integration_deployment.technologies: Talend ESB, homegrown APIs, homegrown SQL, vendor APIs

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce Lightning, truly worthy of a Champion!
lesson_learned.summary: I am a huge fan of the Salesforce Lightning Platform, truly a Lightning Champion! With the enhancements Salesforce has made to their Product over Classic I have been able to not only transform how I utilize Salesforce to improve my business operations but also the processes of my clients.
lesson_learned.liked_most: There truly are a myriad of new features available which are lacking in Classic. One of these is the ability to show/hide various parts of a Salesforce Object's Salesforce Record screen without writing code. Another is the ability and ease of use to develop and utilize new apps.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Its continuously increasing list of features for every process from Sales and Marketing to Customer Service and even Non Profit utilization.
lesson_learned.advice: Reach out to a Salesforce Partner, the on-shore multi-Salesforce Certified team of military Veterans. Utilizing the right Partner for your implementation and enhancement projects on the Salesforce platform greatly increase your ROI in fees paid to Salesforce both now and in the future.

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

additional_context.version_number: Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, CPQ, Communities, AppExchange, etc

general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: Powered by Lightning, built for you!
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce was integral in our company's vetting the Lightning Platform. From our knowledgeable AE to all of the community events and webinars that Salesforce hosted on Lightning; we were truly empowered with valuable information to make the switch to the Salesforce Lightning Platform.
lesson_learned.liked_most: What I like most about the Lightning Platform is how an administrator can declaratively customize the platform quickly to meet the changing needs of the business. A process that previously required a full-time development team and a hefty budget can now be delivered by an advance admin.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: What I dislike most about the Lightning Platform was more about how we implemented the product internally. Due to contractual agreements in place, we were rushed to implement Lightning in six mere weeks restricting our ability to cleanse and restructure ineffective processes.
lesson_learned.advice: To be successful with the Lightning Platform, your organization will need to have a strong practice in Change Management as the implementation of Lightning is truly your opportunity to overhaul/optimize your processes. Take the time to review current processes and compare that functionality to what is available declaratively with Lightning before you jump to implement custom code.

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Very good experience of using Lighting plateform
lesson_learned.summary: I am a saleforce developer and a lead. I have very good experiences with Salesforce Lighting plateform. Things are easy to manage and very powerful. It added many new features and entirely redesigned pages. I have been working in Salesforce  Classic plateform since 2015 and had awesome experience in term of app building.
lesson_learned.liked_most: I like new features and It's easy to customize.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Only the thing I did not like, It doesn't supprt every Salesforce feature.
lesson_learned.advice: Before planning to use Salesforce lightning plateform, do think what is your and your organisation's requirement and if you need what is already in Saleforce basic then do not go for Lightning.
lesson_learned.do_differently: We will start customizing in different way where every user will have some sort of flexibity to manage their work and design their pages as per their need and per their team's requirement.

general_info.review_source: Self directed (Gartner.com, search, ad/promo)

lesson_learned.headline: Extremely powerful gold-standard CRM, but implementation can be lengthy and expensive
lesson_learned.summary: Industry gold standard. It integrates with pretty much everything, and its capabilities seem nearly infinite. The caveat would be that implementation  is not support and often times requires a third-party implementation partner (at additional cost). Learning curve is also quite steep compared to other less powerful platforms.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Extremely configurable and powerful for medium to large scale business, able to automate your full sales cycle as well as account management
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Implementation process and any further configurations past that can be costly and time consuming. There is little support included from the company in terms of implementation.
lesson_learned.advice: Earmark a budget for both time and money in order to properly implement SF fully into your organization, over and beyond the actual costs associated with buying the platform.

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Very good and useful tool for App building and development platform.
lesson_learned.summary:
I was  using google app maker for very long and I wanted to explore Salesforce lighting
platform. There are many points where I find Google app maker is a better deal in this
scenario though Salesforce impressed me with few very good functionality,
which includes , connecting employees, tracking all performance, and integration of everything (various tools) under one umbrella will help you build apps very faster.
You can automate Users task from work flow rules, and many customization's it is allowing
to suit your business requirements. But yes, costly that google.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Ability to customization.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Cost, unnecessary constraints and low speed
lesson_learned.advice: A very useful tool but certainly not the best.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Difficult transition from legacy system to Lightning
lesson_learned.summary: We reimplemented after 4 years on old Salesforce system. The transition was difficult, and we lost a fair amount of functionality in the process.  We are still working to get to where we need it to be but it definitely has a lot of potential once we're up to speed.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Interface is clean, reports are easier to run than in legacy system, and there's more customization on user views.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Fields don't automatically populate correctly, which can lead to errors in data shared among systems.
lesson_learned.advice: Take extra time to configure the system before implementing - it's much harder to fix than it is to get it right the first time.

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Lightning is a worthy upgrade, but there is a learning curve for Classic users.
lesson_learned.summary: Modern interface is mobile ready and a worthy upgrade over Classic. Focused workflow on activities and bringing important information to the forefront for users. Built-in reporting has been enhanced with better dashboards, chart capabilities, and table improvements from the report results. There is a non-trivial learning curve for users that are used to Classic because the interface has been completely overhauled.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Modern interface for today's web applications. Highly customizable page layouts with easy integration to Salesforce Analytics. Much improved dashboard capabilities.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Still missing some capabilities found in Classic.
lesson_learned.advice: Focus on page layout design with end users to improve adoption, especially if migrating from Classic.

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Quicker and Greater User Interface
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce Lighting Platform gives us a greater enhanced look that is neat and simple. Not only the looks but even the efficiency has gone a notch higher compared to applications/UI developed on the classic version. It's pretty easy to develop with proper training which Salesforce has in abundance. On the downside, there are still some features that aren’t supported and there are a limited number of out-of-the-box components.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The platform has various built in features that would make us code less at various instances. This also gives us a better UI instead of using any thrid party CSS to get the required look and feel. Since most of the coding is on the Client side, the applications built are faster and swifter
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The lightning platform is still growing and hence a lot of out of the box features are yet to be added. Also, though there is a lot of documentation available to refer, it's still a bit complex compared to Visualforce. Ceratin features like setting cookies could be difficult.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Great, powerful system that works excellently as a 95% solution
lesson_learned.summary: Working with a sales tool at a non-profit is difficult at times, however the NPSP (non-profit success pack) makes things much easier. Salesforce is incredibly powerful, almost too much so at times, as it can be overwhelming for new users who have never used it (or similar CRM systems) before.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The customizability of the platform is incredible, and Salesforce's "clicks, not code" mantra allows admins who do not understand Apex code the freedom to explore and develop declaratively.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Salesforce is a bit pushy when it comes to adding on services/features/etc, and are always making a sales pitch of some sort. We already pay you lots of money, plz stop trying to get more.
lesson_learned.advice: Use trailhead to get a feel of what Salesforce is capable of! Great self-paced, free training platform that Salesforce offers as a way to learn more about the platform as a whole.
lesson_learned.do_differently: Not try to adapt Salesforce to carry overs from our previous CRM system (iMIS)

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

general_info.review_source: Self directed (Gartner.com, search, ad/promo)

lesson_learned.headline: salesforce complex and highly customizable
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce is a highly customizable cloud platform. It gives us functionality to build a whole social network of your own over Salesforce. The customizations that can be done using Apex provide us with vast functionality.
lesson_learned.liked_most: It provides us to customize the platform according to our own needs.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: There is no standard workflow for managing sales products and opportunities. Different Sales Teams develop their workflows and work accordingly.
lesson_learned.advice: Before doing any customizations inform the development team about the workflow you follow.
lesson_learned.do_differently: I would have standardized the workflows.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Easy to customize and implement
lesson_learned.summary: We built a sales management system that enabled agents store customer data, track customer preferences, past deals and payments. The build was easy and quick, found the product very customizable. The mobile version did not work out very well, but was usable.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The ability to easily customize forms and rules is very useful. We could build simple business rules without having to spend a lot of effort.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: the mobile version is not easy to use , has responsiveness issues and hard to use.
lesson_learned.advice: avoid customization as much as possible.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Nice application with great features
lesson_learned.summary: We use this for accounts for our clients. Alle their information is in Salesforce. You can create hierarchies for accounts that belong together and assign roles to the contactpersons for these accounts. You can also see their orders.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Every bit of information is right there. You can look up information about clients, very easily, so when they call to customer service we can help them straight away. Next to that we can also write information about the customer calls in their accounts so that when they call again about an issue we can look that up in their account.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Sometimes it is hard to find certain information about a customer, so you have to really search the page for the information. Or when a feature we use a lot is always on the bottom on the page it would be easier if there is a button we can click so we can access it easier.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Other

lesson_learned.headline: The adoption, implementation and easyness is really great.
lesson_learned.summary:
Salesforce has been wonderful to work with.
Customer focused with an evolving suite of products.
Increase in Sales Productivity, Sales Win Rate, Revenue and so on...
lesson_learned.liked_most:
Build and run the innovative applications.
Creating and maintaining large data sets can be a nightmare for anybody, but thankfully.
Email templates, which allow you to send out common information to multiple customers.
Now it is available for your mobile devices.
lesson_learned.disliked_most:
Well its really nice but have some limits
Size-Specific Apex Limits
Push Notification Limits
Email Services: Maximum Number of Email Messages Processed 1M
lesson_learned.advice: If you have limited requirement then you can with this, but see the pricing and support as well.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: (en)Lightning
lesson_learned.summary: The Lightning Platform is a huge improvement both for our users and admin/dev tram. When we thought there were huge gaps in the functionality we needed, Salesforce was able to work with us to find a configurable solution.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The huge improvement over Classic. Salesforce continues to be the industry leader and delivers improved functionality with each release.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: When i need support, i feel more knowledgeable than the support agent.
lesson_learned.advice: Lightning is the future and it does not make sense to stay in Classic. Classic is now costing more to maintain and is receiving a minimal amount of updates. Enhancements and new features are almost exclusively for the Lightning Platform.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Great CRM
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce is extremely customizable, widely used, and very portable. It has great security solutions as well as being in the cloud. There is a reason why it is the most popular CRM
lesson_learned.liked_most: The customizability. Salesforce can do almost anything given enough time and resources, and integrates with almost every piece of software around.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The amount of developer resources required. Salesforce devs are often hard to come by and the software requires a decent amount of customizing on the back end for many features to work. However, given enough resources, performance is second to none
lesson_learned.advice: Be patient and invest in Developer resources in order to have the best experience

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Easy adoption of a great tool
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce is a great tool and our Sales team has loved using it. Our previous CRM was difficult to use and slow, while SFDC has been fairly easy to adopt and significantly easier for the Sales team to use. We did contract with a vendor to implement the tool, which helped immensely, especially to configure the instance for our specific needs.
lesson_learned.liked_most: That the Sales team adopted it easily
lesson_learned.disliked_most: It would be extremely challenging to implement the product without the guidance of a contractor/vendor
lesson_learned.advice: Use a vendor for implementation

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Incredible CRM platform, but everything depend of the correct setup..
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce Lightning is a great CRM Platform, but all the potential only is usable if you select a correct consulting firm for the setup
lesson_learned.liked_most: Salesforce can be the best tool to administer sales process, the easy integration with Google Calendar it's great, we can program meeting and refer all the action defined in Google Calendar to an account and a opportunity, we can organize and register all sales activities.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: We was not have a good support for the implementation, the consulting firm dont was able to interpreting and understand all the need for my company, by default salesforce was create to manage B2C sales process, but we need to adapt to solution selling model, a B2B model
lesson_learned.advice: It's very important to ensure the implementation firm understand perfectly all your´s company needs, and put all these in setup service, because all sales teams have different sales model and you want to ensure you can make the difference with these tool, but always depends of the first configuration and interpretation.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Managing sales pipelines just got easier!
lesson_learned.summary: The Salesforce tool has been an excellent initiative for our organization and has helped us manage and track our sales pipeline efficiently!
lesson_learned.liked_most: The custom configuration of sales reports.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The time involved in implementation.
lesson_learned.advice: Ensure you have an appropriate implementation plan in place to help reduce any inefficiencies in managing your sales portfolios.

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Big power of real-time information with Salesforce
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce is a world wide platform used to facilitate big teams to use the same information at the same time. It means, the platform integrate marketing information with sales strategy and useful information with CRM capabilities to let the interations between departments occur fast and accurately. Besides, the possiblities of other softwares integrations are endless.
lesson_learned.liked_most: It integrate different department informations at the same place. It helps to keep the information updated and equal to everyone in the company.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: As a complete platform, it is necessary a specialist to implement any modification or integration, once a person have to go deep into the detail to put it to work
lesson_learned.advice: If you are planning of keep up increasing your team and perhaps doubling your company size. I recommend to already think in a reliable unique solution to use all around your business.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Business impulse that is so necessary.
lesson_learned.summary: Everything we need to expand business opportunities is of the highest quality and with a pleasant interface, it has all the customization and configuration options that we like so much, productivity has increased thanks to a platform that connects the company with the clients.
lesson_learned.liked_most: There are many advantages of Salesforce Lightning Platform, and Lightning facilitates the transformation of complex processes in applications. Boost productivity for every part of your business with Process Builder process and point-and-click workflow tools. It also allows you to create applications with a wide library of easily configurable components that allow you to create sensitive pages and applications by simply dragging and dropping. You can even add custom themes and brands to make any experience yours.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: We have had minor image viewing problems, which have been overcome without problems, or delays, the rest I have no complaints.
lesson_learned.advice: Widely recommended the service is very complete and has been a boost for our company, it allows us to increase productivity and have better communication with our customers, and even among us and that being a collaborative platform the performance has increased level and with the productivity of the company. It has help video and n line tutorials to get to know the platform as much as possible and use all its functions.

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Great for Health Management even though it's not its designed purpose
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce has a useful and simple interface that allows health management units easily and efficiently collect medical data (e.g. patient information, physician information, clinic information, pharmacy information, track adverse events, etc.). I have used a few variations of Salesforce - some more complex, others more rudimentary. Though it is not specifically designed for health management reasons, it works well for this purpose.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Customization of the platform is extremely handy. I have worked and trained with five variants of the platform, and have tested a sixth. Each variant was extremely different, with varying levels of complexity, depending on budget and program needs.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Collection of some pieces of data on some of the variants I have used was not ideal. More complex variants used for health management where note taking was highly implemented made it difficult to extract some data.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Implementation was easy and new UI looks great
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce Lighting has worked well for our organization. It's API easily integrated with our platform to share data when new clients move between lifecycle stages.
lesson_learned.liked_most: It's not down often which is a huge plus for my sales people, it also allows me to slice and dice reports so I can take close tabs on funnel stats and lead sourcing.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: It's a little pricey and support could be better (support is often outsourced offshore).
lesson_learned.advice: There are a bunch of applications out there that all due roughly the same thing. But if you are looking for a high level of customization, Salesforce is probably the best.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Flexibility enhanced from Classic
lesson_learned.summary: Reliable upgrade from salesforce classic, functionality and flexibility in reporting is particularly strong when syncing data from other systems.
lesson_learned.liked_most: It's an open sandbox environment, with integrations so plentiful and some creative thinking it's capable of virtually any digital or operational delivery
lesson_learned.disliked_most: UX is complex and unintuitive at times. Many screens still remain from classic version. Its often a barrier to other business functions willingness to engage which can lead to inconsistent business practices
lesson_learned.advice: add every possible data source to salesforce and connect every system possible in your org. Data investments are what enable lightening to offer it's full benefits

general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: Manke the transition to Lightning now!
lesson_learned.summary: When Lightning was first released, it was lacking some of the best features that Classic had available.  That quickly changes, though, as Salesforce listened to it's customers and made wonderful changes each release that brought newer, better features to Lightning.  Lightning has so many capabilities, it's hard to imagine ever using a different tool.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The flexibility of the platform and the breadth of things you can do declaritively
lesson_learned.disliked_most: There are still some minor glitches in the UI rendering that should be fixed
lesson_learned.advice: If you're just starting out, start in Lightning!

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce Strikes Again
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce always has put out the most robust CRM software on the market. This offering is no different.
lesson_learned.liked_most: As always, Salesforce provides the top of the line business software. this offering is no different.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: As always, Saleforce can be a bit cumbersome for new users. Onboarding was also a challenge with pimited training offered.
lesson_learned.advice: Make sure you train your employees until they feel comfortable haing the software. This is not the kind of tool that is learned overnight.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Robust, advanced, and ESSENTIAL platform, but can be confusing and difficult to learn.
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce is an essential platform to our company's sales and marketing programs. Salesforce Lightning is a very robust and advanced platform that our organization needs to operate smoothly, but it can be difficult and confusing at times to use and understand. Every Salesforce user in our marketing organization uses its capabilities for role-based access for users, campaigns, customizable dashboards, workflow and approval automation, report history tracking, profile pages, managing leads, the sales funnel, and more. Our company recently switched to Lightning, which isn't terribly different than the original user interface, but did take some time to learn.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Salesforce Lightning allows users the ability to customize dashboards. Additionally, this platform is essential to our organization's marketing programs and sales funnel.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Salesforce Lightning is a very robust and powerful program, that comes with a steep learning curve and can often be difficult to use or confusing to understand.
lesson_learned.advice: Our organization has a designated role for managing Salesforce programs, which has been very helpful for marketing members across our marketing teams. It may be beneficial to utilize a designated person who knows and understands Salesforce Lightning really well and can assist other teams in its proper implementation and usage.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Makes implementation easier
lesson_learned.summary: The Salesforce Lightning Platform is a very robust and vast platform for CRM .The platform is a great tool for use inside as well as outside the corporation. Development on the platform saves much of the integration. It is a great tool with all the customer details in one place and quick access for everything
lesson_learned.liked_most: It has a great community.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Some functionalities should have already been present in the platform.
lesson_learned.advice: Worth a try
lesson_learned.do_differently: Make it available for all departments

integration_deployment.implementation_strategy: Worked with both the vendor and 3rd-party service providers

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce is our one source of truth for our customer and lead data.
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce is great because it integrates with so many other software solutions and acts as the one place you can go that houses all your data. It's report functionality is great too, our marketing team uses it all the time for reporting purposes. However, your Salesforce instance is only as good as your Salesforce administrator.
lesson_learned.liked_most: It integrates so easily with all our other marketing tools which makes it easy for reporting purposes.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: It's a complex tool, so it does take time to learn how to navigate and use the tool.
lesson_learned.advice: Your Salesforce instance is only as good as your Salesforce administrator. Make sure you have a good admin to run it for you and keep your data clean.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: User friendly  and can be easily adapted for our business
lesson_learned.summary:
The Salesforce Lighting Platform is easy to use and is easily customised for our business needs. For someone with minimal prior knowledge with Salesforce, the implementation was a success within our organisation. Trailhead has also helped our organisation better understand all the benefits of the Salesforce Lighting Platform.

Although we've hit a few speed bumps when trying to connect third-party apps and when trying to create and track users on their journey, we've had reassurance from Salesforce as well as our provider that it's something that can be done.
lesson_learned.liked_most: It is extremely user-friendly and Salesforce has constantly been transparent.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The ability to track users along their journey.
lesson_learned.advice: Ensure that Salesforce Lighting is something that is right for your organisation before investing the time and money.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Fantastic CRM software to stay organized and maintain customer relationships
lesson_learned.summary: Great application to maintain relationships between customers and manage customer needs, information, and interactions. Quite frankly, I use this application on a regular basis as it is part of my responsibility to maintain relationships across vendors and customers managing multiple tech and functional projects
lesson_learned.liked_most: Given the comprehensive capabilities of the software, it was very east to instal and run in my office computer. I also like the fact that is a cloud based application.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: I find it difficult to run and produce reports through the application. Also, it costs alot of money to customize as well
lesson_learned.advice: Useful in product or customer care organizations where it is important to stay organized when managing clients.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: The change was difficult to adapt. The view looks completely different.
lesson_learned.summary: Lightening has basic issues like opening multiple tabs doesn't work fine always and the page refresh is an issue that we've to manually refresh. Hard to adapt
lesson_learned.liked_most: Eye catchy pages with every options for navigation and the 'question marks' that explains the service in case of questions.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The view doesn't fit in a single page most of the times.
lesson_learned.advice: Customizations are made easy as to how you can integrate with your services.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Very good characteristics and assured integration
lesson_learned.summary: Good user experience, having software services in the cloud that communicate with each other, has allowed to enhance the processes carried out in the company, we have been using it for approximately 3 years, and it is usual to use it for many processes and operations carried out in the company.
lesson_learned.liked_most:
It is easy to enter data and configure, I like reporting, plus productivity is guaranteed by allowing any employee to quickly convert spreadsheets, such as Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets and Quip Spreadsheets, into modern cloud-based applications with only a few clicks
It allows you to extend your applications, data and business processes to your external stakeholders. In addition to integrating CMS content, connect external data and personalize the experience with CRM data. Deploy quickly with an ecosystem of previously created themes and components.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: In years the user interface, has received few updates, we have practically the same functions and updates for a while, although they are functional and we have not had problems with this, it would be convenient to have a renewal at the interface level
lesson_learned.advice: The service is simply good, it invites you to the producer and to establish communication with the clients, it is possible to integrate it with other services from third party suppliers, which helps to make it more efficient and productive.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce Agile Accelerator review
lesson_learned.summary: I was part of our IT department roll-out of the salesforce agile accelerator platform for managing our agile initiatives.  During this process we had the opportunity to meet directly with the SFAA product manager.  Overall, the product manager was very responsive to our suggestions and kept us up to date with changes coming into the application.  The SFAA community also can make suggestions and vote on new features that will be added to future releases
lesson_learned.liked_most: The ability to use the platform as-is out of the box, but have the options of customizing reports and features
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Not all features were updated with the lightening views at first, there was a mix and match of deprecated code
lesson_learned.advice: Make sure you have a saleforce administration and development team that can assist with customizations, deployments, and on-boarding

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Ongoing collaboration with one of the best vendors on the market
lesson_learned.summary: Great tool and the vendor organises frequent updates and orientational calls for our staff. If kept up-to-date, the platform is an invaluable tool for receiving information about the operations of different  company sites and the status of our partnerships with clients.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Detailed information about our projects and clients, account owners and the state of our relationship with a particular client.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Relatively steep learning curve, but thanks to plentiful educational materials mastering the platform is not an issue.
lesson_learned.advice: Salesforce has delivered a great tool, which can be used by businesses in all vertcles. Highly recommended.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Not worth the hype. Incredibly hard to use and a complete mess of a product.
lesson_learned.summary: Incredibly hard to customize, a complete mess of a product. You'd be much better off using a more opinionated constrained piece of software
lesson_learned.liked_most: Reporting. Customization.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: A complete mess of a product.
lesson_learned.advice: Work with an agency to implement. Don't go it alone.

additional_context.deployment_scale: Specific divisions, regions, or business units

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Initial Rollout Was incomplete But has recently Improved a Lot
lesson_learned.summary: The rollout of Lightning Experience for use with third-party apps was initially a process reserved to very experienced developers. Recently the process has been streamlined in every way and is now compatible with a wide range of applications from the salesforce app exchange. The tutorial section has also been updated and features tools and explanations that help even the least experienced developers to layer the lightning experience into existing applications.
lesson_learned.liked_most: UX is very clean and stable and is mobile friendly.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Still lacks some customizability.
lesson_learned.advice: I would reccommend launching the experience for all their users.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Fast to find what I need in minimal clicks.
lesson_learned.summary: This product makes my job easier. Salesforce keeps all of the things I need in one simple to find space and I only need it to do my job.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Fast and simple to use
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Reporting dashboards require you to refresh manually for some. Wish this just updated automatically when you open the report.
lesson_learned.advice: Take your time to learn about what you will use the tool for when you build out your implementation it will solve many issues in the long term.

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Old tool get, new look
lesson_learned.summary: I have used SFDC for a long time, however the new updates are very user friendly.  It takes some time to adjust, and reporting is a bit different, but great new system.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The consolidated view is quicker and easier and allows for faster workflow.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: It takes some time to adjust to where things are located and how to find desired information.  The reporting functions are different and not as user friendly.
lesson_learned.advice: Do not allow people to continue to use SFDC Classic, as it takes longer to get used to Lightening without totally immersing yourself.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: Powerful platform.  Really takes us to new heights as a company!
lesson_learned.summary: Excellent product and truly innovative platform.  Really takes our digital transformation we're undergoing to higher levels.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The sky is the limit with the power of the Salesforce Platform.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Can be somewhat expensive to procure.
lesson_learned.advice: Align on your architecture and governance model before building out your Salesforce development practice.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Excellent platform with many functions
lesson_learned.summary: It is a robust platform that allows communication and interaction between users in a more efficient way, previously we used a Microsoft solution and I must say that this is much higher since it has functions and tools that have made it possible to increase productivity in the company.
lesson_learned.liked_most: There are several advantages that Lightning Platform has made our favorite, since it allows us to integrate with the Salesforce services that we already have in the company, so that it offers us, from the same ecosystem, the tools and services most used by us.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The platform needs to be renewed, I believe that the years go by but Lightning Platform does not receive a change in its interface.
lesson_learned.advice: Widely recommended is a top-notch service and even above the most renowned competitors, it is worth noting the integrated functions that allow using third-party services in Lightning Platform.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Create a schedule, define success metrics, tweak your customization's as needed, and train
lesson_learned.summary: Lightning is the next generation of Salesforce and it's a quantum leap forward in functionality, usability, and speed for every user including admins, developers, and executives.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Easy to use
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Performance
lesson_learned.advice: Please prepare you company

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Highly customizable for each enterprises
lesson_learned.summary: very smooth platform. Easy to customize. We use this to run reports and charts. The transition is not difficult. It goes by smoothly. Able to customize reports per department/team within the organization. Employees also create their own reports for personal tracking.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Easily customizable.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Could have better templates.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: User Friendly and Easy to Work With
lesson_learned.summary: Easy to work with and operate. It is very intuitive and user friendly, with a large scope of abilities and processes available. Incredibly useful for coordinating team projects and tasks.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The ability to trigger alerts to other teams and have others within the company acknowledge that they have seen something. This makes collaboration across people and teams much easier.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Can be a bit cumbersome to get through, but once it gets set up properly it makes everything much easier.
lesson_learned.advice: Ensure that you train staff on all of the different ways they can use this. It has a lot of functions, which is great, but you might not be maximizing your benefits if you don't teach people all of the easiest ways to perform tasks.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: A Good Cloud-Based Collaboration Experience
lesson_learned.summary: The tool appears to have the functionality required to complete the work of two different departments at different stages of the same process. It works as an intermediary handoff tool for moving data from one department to the other, including any experience or notes left by one department, so the next department can understand the story prior to beginning its work with that data.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The ability to configure the tool to do what each stakeholder wanted to do. It can certainly go above and beyond initial expectations in what it can accomplish for the stakeholders and their teams.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: There is a learning curve associated with deployment of any new tool. This tool's deployment was no different, and there was certainly a lot of training and practice involved, as it is a sophisticated tool. Some additional training material would be helpful.
lesson_learned.advice: Be sure to make stakeholder and customer requirements as clear and precise as possible up front to avoid delays and implementation issues.

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce Lighting Platform Is Fast and Efficient to Use
lesson_learned.summary: I love being able to switch the Salesforce Lighting Platform when I am able to for work.  I like being able to use the Lighting Platform templates which are a great tool to have!
lesson_learned.liked_most: Being able to upload the Lighting templates we have programed into Salesforce makes it a quick tool to use!
lesson_learned.disliked_most: N/A
lesson_learned.advice: To use the Lighting Platform service if you want to be able to upload templates efficiently.

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Lightening vs Classic
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce lightening from a visual perspective looks a lot better than classic, however lightening is a lot slower when you have multiple tabs open.  Personally, I don't like that when you open a report you can't view the criteria for the report which is available in classic
lesson_learned.liked_most: visual appeal
lesson_learned.disliked_most: slow, learning curve, report criteria isn't visible
lesson_learned.advice: gradually start using lightening, some reporting and creation of opportunities have a different order of creation

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Classic to Lightning Transition Easy To Use
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce Lightning was really easy to use and understand. By going from Salesforce Classic to Salesforce Lightning, it was an easy transition and made a lot of the functions easiet to use.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The User Experience is easy to use and makes managing accounts seamless.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Unless you are an expert at Salesforce, customizing the platform the way you want is a little difficult.
lesson_learned.do_differently: I would have the entire team trained on this service so that everyone is fully knowledgeable of the benefits and services it provides.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Easily configured
lesson_learned.summary: I enjoy how configurable it is to my needs.  Reporting is very simple and it helps me organize communication to both customers and internal team members.
lesson_learned.liked_most: I enjoy how the platform molds to your specific needs.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The UI could use some work in certain areas.
lesson_learned.advice: Utilize the online tools to help gain an understanding of all of the features.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Love using Salesforce
lesson_learned.summary: My experience with this product has helped me by giving me the opportunity to access large amounts of data at one time. If I need large lists, or I need to access information quickly, I am able to utilize the Salesforce Lightning Platform.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Ability to access data quickly.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Not easily customizable.
lesson_learned.advice: Take time building out what you need.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Relationship with customers.
lesson_learned.summary: The Saleforce platform allows the company to be closer to its client so that we can better understand how each client behaves and thus we can be much more assertive in communicating with our clients
lesson_learned.liked_most: Salesforce helps us consolidate all of the demands we receive from customers through the platform to provide the appropriate treatment to ensure good customer service
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The ease of managing all the features that the platform offers.
lesson_learned.advice: We need more and more to get closer to our end customer and the solutions of Salefocer did not provide this, and consequently the business thrives.

general_info.review_source: Referred (colleague, friend, peer)

lesson_learned.headline: Excellent for new customizations of your business.
lesson_learned.summary: This tool has been a user of how it is implemented by replacing core and different operating processes that are performed on a daily basis making new developments that give productivity to the business.
lesson_learned.liked_most: One of the things that call me the attention of this software is that it has an excellent interface so that each user can understand faster and more efficiently where it should go which helps to better understand.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Nothing.
lesson_learned.advice: The capacity of transformation that this application has is what most surprised me since it has great tools such as Lightning App Builder that allows you to have a library of easily configurable components.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce Lightning Platform Review
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce provides a secured, robust platform that is easy to use and easy to configure by business to meet their business monents.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Business user focus.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Limited availability of senior developers for complex solutions that cannot be resolved via configurations.
lesson_learned.advice: Understand license types to meet your need.

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce implementation for SME
lesson_learned.summary: The support takes time. It isn't as speedy as would be expected from a platform such as this.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The fact that it is scalable, easy to use.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Ease of accessibility of functions can be worked upon to make customer experience better.

lesson_learned.headline: Our Team Loves Using Salesforce Lightning Platform
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce Lightning Platform is great and has been very helpful to our entire team who uses Salesforce. But, I do find my self from time to time switching back to Salesforce Classic due to familiarity.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The look and feel is much more intuitive and less clunky compared to Salesforce Classic
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The interface can be a bit confusing at times.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Untapped potential
lesson_learned.summary: I feel that the software is good at what it's intended to do, although although it seems like the version we use was customized by someone who forgot to ask the end user whether said software changes were actually helpful or not, or what changes might actually improve functionality for the day to day end user.
lesson_learned.liked_most: That it serves as a very capable customer resource management tool. that contains 90% of what I need from this type of software in one location.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: It seems like a lot of effort was put into our build, for some things that just really aren't useful, and little or no thought put into what seems like even simpler changes that would also prove much more useful
lesson_learned.advice: Before paying for costly software customizations, consider and get feedback from the end users that will spend the most time interacting with the software.

lesson_learned.headline: Undoubtedly the Best CRM
lesson_learned.summary: Seamless integration and quick data transfer. Salesforce offers one touch integration with other platforms for data integration.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Salesforce is the most popular CRM out there. It's quick and easy to use.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Customization options could have been better

lesson_learned.headline: SFDC is great once you get used to lightning
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce is great for our sales team to find and qualify leads and help move prospects through sales stages as well as provide insights and analytics into our sales team.
lesson_learned.liked_most:
integration with other applications
support/service is good
lesson_learned.disliked_most:
classic is hard to use
lightning can be buggy

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: A much more powerful UI....with makeup!
lesson_learned.summary: Smooth transition and using their checklist and Lightning Readiness tools.  It highlights the issues that you will have and things you need to fix prior to onboarding.  As with any other major change...onboard slowly if possible.
lesson_learned.liked_most: I love the fact that it seams to make the platform look "cleaner".  This has helped with adoption rates among new users.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Transition was timely due to things needing to be fixed and reprogrammed, but that in itself was workable things to provided tools and support.
lesson_learned.advice: Always onboard slowly in groups if possible.  This will allow you to see where issues may be hidden (though they are typically very few) to keep employees (your clients as well) happy.

lesson_learned.liked_most: The data visualizations are very easy to use.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Vendor (direct, user community)

lesson_learned.headline: Our low code development platform of choice
lesson_learned.summary: Very positive experience which is grounded in the platform capabilities we require for operating in the cloud, the continued innovation delivered in the three annual releases, the support we receive from the customer success organization and the opportunities we have had to get insight into the roadmap and to influence future capabilities
lesson_learned.liked_most: The agility it provides to our teams as they deliver on business intent.  As we configure metadata for an application, the platform generates the baseline web UI, enables API access to data and provides a mobility solution.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Although Platform Encryption generally meets our encryption at rest needs, there are still areas where use of this encryption solution impacts functionality.

general_info.review_source: Self directed (Gartner.com, search, ad/promo)

lesson_learned.headline: Easy to use & contains important information
lesson_learned.summary: In our department, we use Salesforce on a daily basis to store all our customer relationship data. It is very userfriendly, clear where to find and save information so you can share with your colleagues.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Works fast, never blocks, can store enormous amount of info
lesson_learned.disliked_most: when fields have to be completed (moderator activated this) you sometimes can't save other information when leaving other fields blank
lesson_learned.advice: salesforce is one of world's leading CRM systems, it's worth paying for this quality

general_info.review_source: Self directed (Gartner.com, search, ad/promo)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce.com
lesson_learned.summary: Salesforce.com implementation in the cloud in the government space. Modernizing and moving several legacy as well as newer applications in a cloud first strategy implementation. Modernizing staffing, skill sets and delivery methods.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Flexibility and staff training.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Competition for skills in the marketplace, lack of flexibility or customization.
lesson_learned.advice: Verify costs models for ongoing overall TCO.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Utilising a salesforce partner makes for a low risk implementation
lesson_learned.liked_most:
Its entirely cloud based so there are no additional infrastructure responsibilities.
The ability to customise.
The support available, both from the vendor and the wider user community. 
The constant improvements and a great vision of where the product is going.
The ability to integrate with our existing systems.
lesson_learned.disliked_most:
Administration can become complicated as the organisation grows. Especially if you have many different 'Types' of users and 'Apps'
Utilising Partners for customisation can incur quite an additional cost.
lesson_learned.advice: Have a clear vision of what your requirements are as there are several 'flavours' of salesforce to choose from. Making sure you chose the right version up front sets you up for a smooth path to a successful implementation.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Implementation was easy but requires additional add-ons for the platform to be effective
lesson_learned.summary: Overall experience is positive.  The platform itself appears a bit outdated but has proved to be very dynamic.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The add-on tools available
lesson_learned.disliked_most: If you go down the path without utilizing any add-ons, the platform can be not very effective.
lesson_learned.advice: Account for the add-ons and the additional customization that will be required to make it work for your business

general_info.review_source: Self directed (Gartner.com, search, ad/promo)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce is reliable, flexible, and scalable.
lesson_learned.liked_most: It is reliable. I don't worry about system downtime or glitches. If we were to lose data or reports, it would greatly affect us. I don't worry about that. I also like that all up and coming technologies build an integration with Salesforce. So if a new technology comes around, I don't worry I'll miss out since it will probably integrate with Salesforce.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The UI is outdated. The report building and process change management is very hard to do in Salesforce. If they were to keep the same functionality, but improve the UI, it would be a much better experience.
lesson_learned.advice: Assess how important scalability and integrations are to you in choosing a CRM. If you don't care for integrations and don't anticipate growing your team exponentially, Salesforce likely isn't worth the intense time commitment and cost.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Easy to use, modern UX, big potential to scale!
lesson_learned.liked_most: Scalability!  We use it for sales tracking, but the number of custom objects we can build is limitless!
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Takes a little time to learn if you aren't familiar with database management, but it is much easier to learn than other databases.
lesson_learned.advice: Do your research and make sure Salesforce fits your company's wants and needs.  There are numerous competitor's in this space, and each offers a different take on tracking sales and leads.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Endless possibilities
lesson_learned.liked_most: You can do so much with this tool. You can use it to set up email campaign, support programs and progress management, and more. The possibilities are endless.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The interface is pretty clunky, but that will be improved when we upgrade to lightning.
lesson_learned.advice: There is so much Salesforce has to offer -- maybe too much! So start slow, figure out the fundamentals, and go from there.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Great product - challenging integration with legacy systems.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Mature and established, sourcing talent that has existing experience using it is easy.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Almost too much flexibility. If you plan on using it for something other than intended, do so at your own peril!
lesson_learned.advice: Spend a considerable about of time panning integration and ensuring the product connects to legacy applications.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce is impressive but requires business change
lesson_learned.liked_most: SaaS
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Cost
lesson_learned.advice: Start small and pilot first

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Impelementation was great, need mroe support after that

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce is the rare platform that keeps on delivering
lesson_learned.liked_most: Constant innovation. We have three major updates per year and each one is packed with tons of new features that you can opt-in to. The fact that the instances are upgraded without your interaction forces you to get on the train and constantly look for new and better ways to improve what you are doing. It's excellent that SF pushes everyone
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Sometimes they can move just a little too fast and they have some bugs come up that I wish would've been handled in QA.
lesson_learned.advice: Fully jump in and you will be amazed at how much the SF platform can do.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Stack is already the most mature of the breed and growing fast.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Zero to Mobile maturity in 60 seconds. The mobile internet and all its security threats and constant changes are no longer something your IT department has to keep up with.  You just build processes and manage integrations. No need for a mobile team, responsive designers, native app developers for all the devices and all the fractured android-space. You just solve business problems. Bugs are only process bugs not huge device lab, can't reproduce bugs.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Licensing can get pretty overwhelming. Products, modules, object, apps, governor limits. Needs to continue to get simpler to license and manage.
lesson_learned.advice: Make sure you are fully versed in the balance of talent vs. licensing that you will need to make the most out of this investment. Tipping the scale in either direction can lead to unrealized value.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: The value proposition drove adoption.  Stability and development speed led to reliance.
lesson_learned.liked_most: The platform itself is extremely reliable and innovative.  I know I can build and operate new features on the platform with minimal overhead.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: The sales and marketing of the platform and related products requires savvy management.
lesson_learned.advice: Get experienced help deploying and integrating Salesforce with your enterprise.  This is so you can get an understanding both of what Salesforce is offering and what your true need is.  It can be difficult to see past the product marketing to know what the platform is truly capable of doing for your business.  There is a lot of value in building on the Salesforce model but it was difficult for my organization to fully embrace that without an outside perspective.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Build and implementation was fast and simple but hampered by challenges within our company
lesson_learned.liked_most:
Although it can become a challenge for a busy team, one of the things we like most about the product(s) are the fact that they are forever being updated and new functionality is being added.   Similarly, we really appreciate having a vendor who'll regularly take time to understand your business and what you're looking to achieve to help you land a successful project delivery.  The support doesn't end there and constanstly work with us and their product teams to help push the future vision. 

The constant investment into the platform is evident with several major enhancements in the last couple of years including Lightning and now Einstein.   Lightning is a massive step change for the UI and long overdue from Salesforce, the execution of which is superb.  Lightning further improves our platform productivity by enabling us to create a 'component drive ecosystem' within our company where we can re-use components (say a graph or account behaviour component) across multiple businesses and multiple Salesforce instances.
lesson_learned.advice:
Take your time to learn the products. They are numerous and forever being updated with each release (three times a year) and always review the full functionality before starting to code custom functionalities.  

Consider 'point and click' configuration as the preferred first option or using appexchange. If you do not find what you want to do in these methods, consider discussing your requirements with the Salesforce product team to understand whether your needs could be met in the near future with a roadmap item.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce listens to it's customers
lesson_learned.liked_most: True Cloud platform where we can take advantage of new features without having to do upgrades.  Strong focus on customer engagement where they always deliver features we need.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Still centered around CRM base features which don't translate to app development practices.
lesson_learned.advice: Leverage out of the box capabilities rather than custom code.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Highly Customize-able Platform with Plenty of Resources To Guide You
lesson_learned.liked_most: The flexibility and adaptability - the nature of a platform is to enable me to build for whatever processes/challenges I have, and Salesforce does exactly that.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Multi-tenant limiters - I understand why they are there, but it does require that I make strange development decisions to ensure the code is 'bulkified' and won't fail due to resource usage.
lesson_learned.advice: Take the time to understand the implications of your use cases and license types - there's money to be saved in limited licenses that nevertheless provide the same types of access.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Fully integrated application library, encourages innovation and collaboration
lesson_learned.liked_most: Easily scalable, enhanceable, customizable - even for our non-IT staff.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: I cannot think of anything I would put in the dislike category.
lesson_learned.advice: Commit to the big picture goals for your organization; do not let the small details derail development.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Salesforce makes it easy to create custom applications.
lesson_learned.liked_most: It is a highly available cloud solution.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Announcements of new features usually come out way before the feature or product is even available.
lesson_learned.advice: Use Salesforce platform experts to create your apps.  They can architect and build a solution easily and quickly.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Started as a trial and now we have more platform users than SaAS users
lesson_learned.liked_most: Model driven, API first. Things just work.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Licensing model (SaAS objects, platform related costs e.g. on custom objects need some commercial planning around solutions when driving for cost transparency.
lesson_learned.advice: Own team learns by doing. As platform works one can focus working with own customers.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Building CRUD apps are simple, days to weeks, not months.
lesson_learned.liked_most: Simple decision making on what to use.
lesson_learned.disliked_most: Licensing model is too restrictive and everything requires a new license when you want to use a new feature.
lesson_learned.advice: Understand the limitations of the Salesforce PaaS and how that will impact your org structure and licensing.

general_info.review_source: Invited by Gartner (email, event, account rep)

lesson_learned.headline: Increasing productivity through new technologies that just work.
